1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Snipping elements.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Snip
6  ( -- * Type
7    Snip, Snip2,
8  
9    -- * Index
10    snipIndex, snipIndexFull, snipIndexBoth,
11  
12    -- * Picking elements
13    snipFrom, snipOff, snipBoth,
14    snipShare, snipLeft, snipRight,
15
16    -- * Reorder elements
17    snipForward, snipBackward, 
18    snipForward2, snipBackward2,
19    snipOrder,
20  ) where
21
22import qualified Data.List                           as List
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture            as O
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude        as B
25
26
27-- --------------------------------------------  Type
28
29-- | Snipping elements using indicies.
30type Snip a = [Int] -> O.Map [a]
31
32-- | Snip for differenct type values.
33type Snip2 a b = (Snip a, Snip b)
34
35
36-- --------------------------------------------  Index
37
38-- | Indices of shared elements.
39--
40--   >>> snipIndex "bdk" "abcdefg"
41--   [1,3]
42--
43snipIndex :: (Eq a) => [a] -> [a] -> [Int]
44snipIndex ks xs = filter (>= 0) $ snipIndexFull ks xs
45
46-- | Indicies of shared-and-unknown elements.
47--
48--   >>> snipIndexFull "bcx" "abcdefg"
49--   [1,2,-1]
50--
51snipIndexFull :: (Eq a) => [a] -> [a] -> [Int]
52snipIndexFull ks xs = map ind ks where
53    ind k = maybe (-1) id $ List.elemIndex k xs
54
55-- | Left-and-right indices of shared elements.
56--
57--   >>> snipIndexBoth "abc" "bcd"
58--   ([1,2], [0,1])
59--
60snipIndexBoth :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a] -> ([Int], [Int])
61snipIndexBoth xs1 xs2 = (snipIndex sh xs1, snipIndex sh xs2) where
62    ind = snipIndex xs1 xs2
63    sh  = B.sort $ snipFrom ind xs2
64
65
66-- --------------------------------------------  Picking elements
67
68-- | Pick up indexed elements.
69--
70--   >>> [1,3] `snipFrom` "abcdefg"
71--   "bd"
72--
73--   >>> [1,3] `snipFrom` "ABCDEFG"
74--   "BD"
75--
76snipFrom :: Snip a
77snipFrom ps xs = loop ps xs 0 where
78    loop pps@(p:ps2) (x:xs2) i =
79        case compare p i of
80          EQ             -> x : loop ps2 xs2 (i + 1)
81          GT             ->     loop pps xs2 (i + 1)
82          LT | p >= 0    -> snipFrom pps xs  -- restart
83             | otherwise -> snipFrom ps2 xs  -- ignore minus index
84    loop pps@(p:ps2) [] i
85        | p < i     = snipFrom pps xs  -- restart
86        | otherwise = snipFrom ps2 xs  -- ignore large index
87    loop [] _ _ = []
88
89-- Simple implementation
90-- snipFrom :: [Int] -> Map [a]
91-- snipFrom ps xs = map (xs !!) ps
92
93-- | Cut off indexed elements.
94--
95--   >>> (snipIndex "ce" "abcdefg") `snipOff` "ABCDEFG"
96--   "ABDFG"
97--
98snipOff :: Snip a
99snipOff ps xs = loop 0 xs where
100    loop _ [] = []
101    loop p (x:xs2)
102        | p `elem` ps  =     loop (p + 1) xs2
103        | otherwise    = x : loop (p + 1) xs2
104
105-- | Pair of picking-up and cutting-off elements.
106--
107--   >>> (snipIndex "ce" "abcdefg") `snipBoth` "ABCDEFG"
108--   ("CE", "ABDFG")
109--
110snipBoth :: [Int] -> [a] -> ([a], [a])
111snipBoth ps xs = (snipFrom ps xs, snipOff ps xs)
112
113-- | Take shared elements.
114--
115--   >>> "abcd" `snipShare` "bcefg"
116--   "bc"
117--
118snipShare :: (Eq a) => O.Bin [a]
119snipShare xs ys = snipIndex xs ys `snipFrom` ys
120
121-- | Take left-side elements.
122--
123--   >>> "abcd" `snipLeft` "bcefg"
124--   "ad"
125--
126snipLeft :: (Eq a) => O.Bin [a]
127snipLeft xs ys = snipIndex ys xs `snipOff` xs
128
129-- | Take right-side elements.
130--
131--   >>> "abcd" `snipRight` "bcefg"
132--   "efg"
133--
134snipRight :: (Eq a) => O.Bin [a]
135snipRight xs ys = snipLeft ys xs
136
137
138-- --------------------------------------------  Reorder elements
139
140-- | Move indexed elements to the front.
141--
142--   >>> (snipIndex "cd" "abcdefg") `snipForward` "ABCDEFG"
143--   "CDABEFG"
144--
145snipForward :: Snip a
146snipForward ps xs = case snipBoth ps xs of
147                      (snip, rest) -> snip ++ rest
148
149-- | Move indexed elements to the rear.
150--
151--   >>> (snipIndex "cd" "abcdefg") `snipBackward` "ABCDEFG"
152--   "ABEFGCD"
153--
154snipBackward :: Snip a
155snipBackward ps xs = case snipBoth ps xs of
156                       (snip, rest) -> rest ++ snip
157
158-- | Double forward.
159snipForward2 :: Snip2 a b
160snipForward2 = (snipForward, snipForward)
161
162-- | Double backward.
163snipBackward2 :: Snip2 a b
164snipBackward2 = (snipBackward, snipBackward)
165
166-- | Reorder elements.
167--
168--   >>> snipOrder "bca" "abc" "ABC"
169--   "BCA"
170--
171snipOrder :: (Eq a) => [a] -> [a] -> O.Map [c]
172snipOrder to from
173    | to == from = id
174    | otherwise  = snipFrom $ snipIndex to from
